intro: Fleischmannia microstemon, commonly known as the small-stamen fleischmannia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine pubescence, while its flowers are usually white or pale blue. Fleischmannia microstemon is known for its resilience to drought and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
